title: 107_hr377
content: Section 1 introduces incentives for clean-fuel vehicles used by businesses in empowerment zones and renewal communities. It amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide additional incentives for clean-fuel vehicles. The zone clean fuels credit for eligible enterprise zone businesses includes the zone clean-fuel property credit and the zone clean-burning fuel use credit. The zone clean-fuel property credit covers qualified clean-fuel vehicle property and refueling property, with limitations on qualified clean-fuel vehicle property. The cost limit for qualified clean-fuel vehicle property is $2,000 for most vehicles, $5,000 for trucks or vans up to 26,000 pounds, and $50,000 for larger trucks, vans, or buses. The cost limit for qualified clean-fuel vehicle refueling property in eligible enterprise zones is $100,000 or the cost of the property reduced by a certain amount. The property must be placed in service during the taxable year. The clause (ii) specifies the reduction for amounts previously taken into account under certain conditions. It includes the aggregate amount taken into account for preceding taxable years and the aggregate amount taken into account for property placed in service at the location for all preceding taxable years. The zone clean-burning fuel use credit is 50 cents for each gasoline gallon equivalent of clean-burning fuel used by an eligible enterprise zone business to propel qualified clean-fuel vehicle property. The zone clean-burning fuel use credit applies to businesses in empowerment zones or enterprise communities within nonattainment areas. It also applies to businesses outside these zones if the clean-fuel vehicle property is used substantially within the designated areas. The term 'clean-burning fuel' is defined in the context of this credit. The term 'clean-burning fuel' is defined in the context of the zone clean-burning fuel use credit. It includes compressed natural gas and excludes fuel that is not clean-burning. Qualified clean-fuel vehicle property and refueling property are also defined in relation to this credit. Gasoline gallon equivalent is the amount of clean burning fuel determined by the Secretary. The Secretary determines the amount of fuel with a Btu content of 114,000 for a tax credit. No double benefit is allowed for expenses eligible for other tax deductions. Renewal Communities receive additional incentives under the Internal Revenue Code. "SEC. 1400K. RENEWAL COMMUNITY CLEAN FUELS CREDIT." For purposes of section 1397C, a renewal community is treated as an empowerment zone, a renewal community business as an enterprise zone business, and qualified renewal property as qualified zone property. The zone clean fuels credit is added to the general business credit under section 38 of the Code. Section 280C of the Code is amended to deny double benefits for certain expenses with allowable credits. No deduction allowed for clean-burning fuel expenses equal to zone clean fuels credit determined for the taxable year under section 1397C. Special rules apply for zone clean fuels credit under section 38 of the Code. The zone clean fuels credit is a credit allowed under subsection (a) by reason of section 1397B, and it is not subject to certain limitations when applied separately with respect to the credit. The zone clean fuels credit, allowed under section 1397B, is subject to limitations on carryback and deduction for certain unused business credits under the tax code. The text discusses amendments to the tax code related to the empowerment zone clean fuels credit. Amendments include changing references from section 1397C to section 1397D and adding a new paragraph (9) for the clean fuels credit. Amendments to the tax code involve changing references from section 1397C to section 1397D in various sections. Amendments to the tax code involve changing references from section 1397C to section 1397D in various sections, including section 1202(a)(2) and the table of subparts for part III of subchapter U of chapter 1. Amendments to the tax code include defining incentives for clean-fuel vehicles and general provisions. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2000.
